intro: Sapium pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican palmetto, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Sapium pittieri is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
